title: Danielle Smith’s Campaign Strategist Writes Insider Account of Alberta Premier’s Path to Victory
description: UCP Leader Danielle Smith delivers her victory speech in Calgary on May 29, 2023. Alberta's United Conservative Party rode a wave of rural support to win a renewed majority in the provincial election, but not before the NDP took a big bite out of its support. (The Canadian Press/Jeff McIntosh)

title: RFK Jr. Says He’d End Russia–Ukraine War If Elected
description: Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., nephew of former U.S. President John F. Kennedy, speaks to people gathered under the Victory Column in the city center to hear speeches during a protest against coronavirus-related restrictions and government policy, in Berlin, Germany, on Aug. 29, 2020. (Sean Gallup/Getty Images)

title: ‘Communist Party Continues to Deny Extent of Massacre’: Poilievre Marks Tiananmen Square Massacre Anniversary
description: Police officers take away a member of the public in the Causeway Bay area in Hong Kong on June 3, 2023, on the eve of the 34th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square Massacre, which took place in China on June 4, 1989. (Louise Delmotte/AP Photo)

title: Police Identify Man Found in Quebec Fishing Tragedy in Which 4 Children Also Died
description: A Sûreté du Québec police car is seen in Montreal in a file photo. (Paul Chiasson/The Canadian Press)

title: Wildfires in Western Quebec Prompt Thousands More Evacuees to Relocate
description: Smoke rises from burning trees near Chapais, in Northern Quebec, on June 2, 2023. (The Canadian Press/HO-SOPFEU Prevention and Communications-Audrey Marcoux)

title: Two Full-Capacity Passenger Trains Collide With Goods Train in India, Leading to ‘Monumental Tragedy’
description: Rescuers work at the site of passenger trains accident in Balasore district, eastern Indian state of Orissa, on June 3, 2023. (Arabinda Mahapatra/AP Photo)

title: Saudis Announce Additional Oil Production Cuts Following OPEC+ Meeting
description: Representatives of OPEC member countries attend a press conference after the 45th Meeting of the Joint Ministerial Monitoring Committee and the 33rd OPEC and non-OPEC Ministerial Meeting in Vienna, Austria, on Oct. 5, 2022. (Vladimir Simicek/AFP via Getty Images)

title: UK Moves Ahead With Indo-Pacific Strategy to Contain CCP Threat

title: ‘A Symbol of Defiance’: Memory of Tiananmen Square Massacre Kept Alive by Advocates
description: Chinese dissident Hu Yang in May 2023. (Shawn Ma/The Epoch Times)

title: Toronto Police Seek Suspect Who Put Transit Passenger on Chokehold in Random Attack
description: Police cars surround a TTC streetcar on Spadina Ave. in Toronto on Jan. 24, 2023, after a stabbing incident. (The Canadian Press/Arlyn McAdorey)

title: Taiwan and Tuvalu Sign Agreements to Strengthen Technical, Diplomatic Cooperation
description: (L-R) Jarden Kephas, Nauru’s ambassador to Taiwan; Limasene Teatu, Tuvalu's ambassador to Taiwan; Taiwan’s foreign minister Joseph Wu; AIT Director W. Brent Christensen; Sandra Oudkirk, State Department's Deputy Assistant Secretary for Australia, New Zealand, and the Pacific Island; and Neijon Rema Edwards, the Marshall Islands’ ambassador to Taiwan, take a group photo at the Pacific Islands Dialogue in Taipei, Taiwan, on Oct. 7, 2019. (Taiwan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: Indian Railways Official Says Error in Signaling System Led to Crash That Killed 275 People
description: People watch at the site where trains that derailed, in Balasore district, in the eastern Indian state of Orissa on June 4, 2023. (Rafiq Maqbool/AP Photo)

title: South Korean Unification Minister: Walking the Line Between US and China Won’t End Well
description: Japan's Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi (R) poses with South Korea's Unification Minister Kwon Young-se (front L) during the latter's visit in Tokyo on March 23, 2023. (Japan Pool / JIJI Press / AFP via Getty Images)

title: Halifax-Area Wildfire 100 Percent Contained, but Shelburne Fire Still out of Control
description: The collapsed bridge between the Clyde River and Port Clyde in Nova Scotia smoulders in this May 31, 2023 handout photo. (The Canadian Press/HO-Communications Nova Scotia)

description:
Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy attends news briefing

title: A Chinese PLA Veteran Expresses Remorse Over June 4 Tiananmen Massacre in 1989
description: A Chinese man stands alone to block a line of tanks heading east on Beijing’s Avenue of Eternal Peace during the Tiananmen Square massacre on June 5, 1989. (Jeff Widener/AP Photo)

title: World’s Spy Chiefs—Including China’s—Meet in Secret Conclave in Singapore
description: Director of National Intelligence Avril Haines and CIA Director William Burns depart an event where President Joe Biden announced his intent to nominate Gen. Charles Q. Brown, Jr., to serve as the next Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff in the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington on May 25, 2023. (Drew Angerer/Getty Images)

title: Pentagon Snubbed, China’s Defense Minister Meets With Australian Counterpart
description: Australian Deputy Prime Minister and Defence Minister Richard Marles speaks to the media during a press conference after the release of the Defence Strategic Review at Parliament House in Canberra, Australia, on April 24, 2023. (AAP Image/Lukas Coch)

title: City of St. John’s Charges 70-Year-Old Woman for Feeding Pigeons in Her Backyard
description: A man feeds pigeons in the courtyard of Ezzitouna Mosque, the oldest mosque in Tunisia on Oct. 23, 2015. (AP Photo/Mosa'ab Elshamy)

title: ‘I Will Not Bend’: MP Jenny Kwan Says She Won’t Allow China to Erase History
description: NDP MP Jenny Kwan speaks to reporters about her briefing with CSIS where they confirmed that she was a target of foreign interference, in the Foyer of the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa, on May 29, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Justin Tang)
